discussion.p: Another similar issue to the operator< vs greater in nth_element but not as direct occurs in :

blockquote.p: -1- A heap is a particular organization of elements in a range between two random access iterators [a,b). Its two key properties are:

ol.li: There is no element greater than *a in the range and
*a may be removed by pop_heap(), or a new element added by push_heap(), in O(log(N)) time.

discussion.p: As noted by Richard Smith, it seems that the first bullet should read:

blockquote.p: *a is not less than any element in the range

discussion.p: Even better the heap condition could be stated here directly, instead of leaving it unspecified, i.e.,

blockquote.p: Each element at (a+2*i+1) and (a+2*i+2) is less than the element at (a+i), if those elements exist, for i>=0.

discussion.p:
But may be that was may be intentional to allow other heap organizations?
See also follow-up discussion of c++std-lib-32780.
